title: The Autofill Feature
body:
I agree that the autofill feature may allow the q to be a lot faster but im beggin you riot, please remove it, i have heard from almost more than 20 people as friends or strangers on league that the autofill system made a player play a role they do not intend to be good at for around 20 minutes. Having to suffer then to lose the game is incredibly annoying, for most people. Please riot, fix this autofill issue going around.
Regards Summoner

replies.body:
I'll say the same thing I always say in these threads.

I'm a Jungle main, and I've NEVER suffered at the hands of Auto-Fill, I've never been Auto-Filled, and I will never be Auto-Filled.

And if you ever say you "can't support" uninstall the game and remove yourself from the LoL community entirely.
You don't deserve to be playing the game.

It's not about the fact that you "can't support" its just that a lot of people are bad at it and would rather not waste their time practising that role. I personally hate support with a passion so if I ever get given it I would rather dodge then waste 30 minutes of my life not having any fun.

Look if you "cant support" its freaking simple. Get {{champion:267}} {{champion:16}} or {{champion:37}}  Max your heal Sit at the back, Ult into group fights. Heal your Carry. There is very little skill required. Just Remember to build {{item:3092}} and {{item:2045}} .
I think you both missed the second part of what I was saying, I don't actually enjoy playing support at all.
Oh i noticed i just ignored it. Because that is a shitty attitude to have.
So playing League of Legends requires me to enjoy every role? And just because I don't like something I automatically have a terrible attitude?
Well I don't see whats wrong with support I have more fun in that role then any other role (except jg but thats only when i steal dragon/baron).

If you want to climb, you have to do everything.

Oh look at that it's like real life, if you want to climb the work ladder and get more money you got to stick your nose and tongue up someone's arsehole.

Nobody likes doing that, but they still do it, and they do it well because they want money.

You want elo?
You fucking learn to play support well.

>
> Just Remember to build {{item:3092}} and {{item:2045}} .

Don't build {{item:2045}} straight away its a waste of gold make that your last item just settle with {{item:2049}} early.

Actually Ruby Sightstone isn't a waste of gold anymore.

Perhaps read some patch notes once in a while instead of listening to a youtube video from 4 seasons ago.

Okay, so as a support my building style is buy sightstone and then boots of speed and the second component of my support item.

Now I believe this is stronger then ruby sightstone because, if you rush ruby sightstone over the second sup item. I feel weaker because it removes the following stats:

{{item:2045}} Provides: +400 hp and 1 extra ward. compared to

{{item:3302}} Provides: +75 Health, + 2 gold/10 seconds and an enhanced passive. or
{{item:3098}} Provides: +15 AP, +2gold/10 seconds +75%/mana regen and an enhanced passive or
{{item:3096}} Provides: +25% base hp/regen, +75% /Base mana regen, +10% CD reduction and an enhanced passive.

Ruby Sightstone isn't a waste of gold but I don't recommend buying it early.
Last Pre-Season Ruby Sightstone was buffed to include CDR for Item Actives/Passives and Summoner Spells.
Might just be i Play tank supports like Leo and Naught that makes me value the extra HP.

What's difficult about not taking CS and using CC or poking or soaking up damage?

Hell you can even go Karma and build Magic Pen with your support items and you'll do the most damage on the team while still supporting.

Supports that do the most damage are Brand and Zyra. But remember everyone, you are there to SUPPORT, not to do damage. That is secondary. If you're trying to carry as a support, then you are letting your team down in most cases.

A Support carries most effectively by surprise surprise SUPPORTING.

You've got 4 other team mates who's job it is to do damage, two of those should be doing more than enough damage themselves.

Peeling, healing, negating damage, negating enemy healing. This is stuff the rest of your team wont be doing.
This is stuff that SOMEONE has to do, and thus is up to the support for the most part.

If you genuinely support your team, you will win more than you lose.

People have short memories. Back in season 5 when pick order was a thing, more often than not if you were last pick you got lumped with the support role. And you either dodged or learnt how to play the role. It's not a hard role to play, but you just have to be thinking about "SUPPORTING" your team. You aren't there to get farm or kills or do a bunch of damage. That's not the role. The role requires you to establish vision control, communicate with your team while they are busy and perhaps miss certain things happening, and also peeling for your carries (the ones in your team that are doing the most damage). Damage output is secondary to those things. Even Likkrit builds a sightstone on Brand support, because he knows the role. He might still do a lot of damage, but he still plays his role firstly. 

It's a selfless role and a good skillset to learn. it also teaches you how the game really works. You will understand more about the other roles by playing them, which makes you a better overall player.

Many players try to one trick their way to higher levels, but then they hit a brick wall. An example of this is the NA player Hashshinshin. This guy will not get picked up by a pro team until he actually starts to understand how the game really works. (check LS's videos with IWillDominate on youtube for more explanation). He may be a Jax god, but overall he's a very average player that made it to challenger by playing one role. Perhaps if he played Jungle more due to autofill he also would become a better player.
